name: transvaluation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of judging the value of something in a completely new and different way : Her work involves a transvaluation of traditional values and a powerful affirmation of life. It is clear by end of the novel that momentous transvaluations are taking place.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a need to rethink the whole thing objectively, leading to a transvaluation of our existing morality.Nietzsche called for a positive transvaluation of the present time.This dictatorial regime was a grotesque parody of a transvaluation of Western values.
